user.title: Configure ambient sensors
user.description:
Comfort Advisor compares the indoor and outdoor comfort levels to suggest when windows can be open. Use the [Comfort Advisor blueprint](https://github.com/lymanepp/ha-blueprints/blob/main/comfort-advisor.yaml) for creating automations.

Tip: you can use current temperature and humidity sensors from a weather integration if you don't have outdoor temperature and humidity sensors.

comfort.title: Configure comfort settings
comfort.description:
The [Summer simmer index](http://summersimmer.com/home.htm) is a modern heat index equation. For SSI values between {70} and {77}, most people are comfortable, but slightly cool. From {77} to {83}, nearly everyone feels quite comfortable, while from {83} to {91} most are comfortable, but slightly warm.

[Dew point temperatures](https://weatherology.com/trending/articles/Professor-Paul-Dew-Point-Relative-Humidity.html) tell the absolute quantity of moisture that is in the air, thereby indicating how humid it will feel outside to our bodies. On the other hand, relative humidity only tells us how saturated the air is compared to how much it can hold at the current temperature.
